name: misc eatdrinksleep

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything said about this hotel in these reviews is absolutely true! The owners deliver the best customer service, the rooms are cozy, you couldn't ask for a better location, and the breakfast is excellent. I can't imagine that any other hotel in Amsterdam could pay as much attention to detail.
reviews.title: The Absolute Best!

likes.liked: — The owners,loction, breakfast, free mini bar

reviews.text: The hotel is obviously very popular and was booked up the entire time we were there. I just hope there are rooms available next time I visit Amsterdam!
reviews.title: Best Small Hotel Anywhere

reviews.text: We stayed at the MISC hotel in Amsterdam for 4 days in March along with my wife. I can simply say that it is the best small hotel we have ever stayed in. The hostess Rachel is from American and her husband is from Holland, so they are a perfect pair for American visitors. They were also unusually attentive to all of their guests –they even made breakfast for us before the usual opening time so that we could eat before cathing an early plane home.—and are very knowledgeable about Amsterdam. The nice touches and amenities were almost too numerous to mention. They included free snacks, soft drinks, and mineral water in the room, a cooked to order breakfast served until noon, with great bread and pastries, umbrellas for the rainy March weather, and even a very friendly cat. The location of the hotel is great-right on a canal and walking distance of the train station, Dam square, and the museums and other sites. Our room was small, but very neat and quiet. The room was also a good value for the money, although somewhat expensive for Americans due to the low value of the dollar. If only they could do something about the rainy Spring weather!
reviews.title: Made me want to run my own boutique hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I almost don't want to wax lyrical about the Hotel Misc (since there are only 6 rooms and I'd like to be able to get one of them next time I go back!) but it really is an absolute treat and I can't fault Rachel and Pepijn's conscientious devotion to running the place.
reviews.title: Good things in small packages

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Most of the other reviews cover why this is such a rare and terrific find:- individually themed rooms with canal or courtyard views, free and restocked daily minibar with soft drinks, chocolate and savoury snacks (don't worry though - you can still get a beer or a glass of wine from the lobby!), fantastic location, incredible and laid back breakfasts (Pepijn's homemade Seville orange marmalade is outstanding) etc etc. But for me it was really the comfortable feeling you get - it is like staying with friends, but ones who don't intrude and let you get on with whatever you want to do.
reviews.title: A jewel in the heart of Amsterdam

likes.liked: — Pepijn & Rachel (the hosts), the location and breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had the pleasure of staying at Hotel Misc for 7 nights. The owners were fantastic and gave us ideas and suggestions of where to go during our stay. They even arranged a 2 hour canal tour that we highly recommend! The garden rooms face the back and are a little smaller, but alot quieter. Note there is no air conditioning so can get a little warm in the summer months. There is a free standing fan provided in the room. The breakfast provided is delicious and catered to your choices. There is even a resident cat if you are missing your pets at home. I would not hesitate to recommend this to anyone who is planning on coming to Amsterdam. Just be prepared for steep stair climbing to your room, but totally worth the individually styled rooms. The location is prime and a short walk from Centraal station. Do not hesitate to stay here!
reviews.title: Oasis on the canal

likes.disliked: — noisy stairwell and hearing other guests come in late during night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was wonderful, my husband and I stayed there last night and absolutely loved it. They were told it was our honeymoon and sent up a bottle of champagne then when we came back from our evening out there was a piece of chocolate cake... it was like every time we left we came back to a sweet little surprise. The owners were a very sweet couple. A full breakfast was provided and the fridge in our room was stocked with complimentary drinks. Everything was clean and the white bed linens were beautiful and comfortable. Overall it was fabulous.
reviews.title: Wonderful place

likes.disliked: — very steep staircase, there might be an elevator, we never asked

reviews.text: I chose Hotel Misc based on all the great reviews here, and it absolutely lived up to my (high) expectations.
reviews.title: All the great reviews are absolutely true!
The "Misc" made Amsterdam Fantastic
reviews.text: As others have mentioned, what makes this place so special are its owners, Rachel and Pepijn. They are friendly without being intrusive, incredibly helpful, and seemed genuinely interested in the goings-on and satisfaction of their guests.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast they provided was fantastic: bread, meat, cheese, an egg cooked to order with bacon, and fresh baked croissants, not to mention cappucino, latte or any other kind of coffee, teas, and fresh squeezed orange juice. It all kept me going well into the afternoon.
reviews.title: Great, Great, Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I booked a 5 day break for our 1st Wedding Anniversary, in Amsterdam. Just by searching Google we found Hotel Misc.
reviews.title: A hidden treasure of a Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had booked one of the canal facing rooms which are slightly larger + more expensive than garden facing rooms at the back. Each room is themed in its decor. Choice of room cannot be guaranteed, although we asked for the Rembrandt room and got it!
reviews.title: Perfect Location, excellent hosts

likes.disliked: — Our room had seen slightly better days - but was clean, and had everything we needed

reviews.title: Incredible place & people & value
reviews.text: First things first. Our room at the front was very noisy! The windows aren't double glazed and car horns / tourists / bin men are a constant nuisance throughout the night! If we had known the rooms at the front were so noisy we would have chosen a room at the back.
Stayed here on a work trip and compared to the normal corporate drudgery of a large business hotel, this place was wonderful. It was like staying in someone's house!
reviews.title: Loved it!

likes.liked: — Attention to detail of the very friendly hosts
likes.disliked: — The stairs would be tricky if you were very drunk (I was only moderately drunk)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was cool, lots of light.
reviews.title: A little gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Woooow what a good choice

likes.liked: — Friednly owners, complimentary minibar and terrific breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The toiletries were great and smelt good
reviews.title: Don't delay, book it now!

likes.liked: — Friendly staff, clean rooms, spacious, great value for money
likes.disliked: — The fact that we had to leave!

description: Misc eatdrinksleep is a lovely little hideaway located on a wide canal, close to the picturesque Nieuwmarkt Square, in the heart of the historic city centre of Amsterdam. This modernized 17th-century canal house features just six personally styled rooms. Each is a unique mix of style, charm and practicality, and overlooks either the canal or a fetching Amsterdam secret garden. We offer exceptional hospitality for the cultural pilgrim, the hopeless romantic and weary business traveler alike. We hope that our unique canal house hotel becomes your home away from home in Amsterdam!
